content: >see marianated yarns https //marianatedyarns com/products/conditional-love-cowl kits for the conditional love scarf + conditional love scarf https //youtu be/iydvx_uo1hg the if command is used extensively in computer programming to simplify complex tasks this command specifies a condition the program does one thing if the condition is met and something else otherwise the conditional love scarf uses a conditional knit stitch cond-k and a conditional purl stitch cond-p when working these stitches look at the next stitch on your needle if it s the same colour as your working yarn you work it otherwise you slip it why do this to create a 3 colour reversible scarf with a different colour pattern on each side using the same stitch pattern for every row how is this possible the conditional stitches extract the complexity from the row by row instructions of the pattern then you look at the stitches on your needles to determine how you work them this sounds strange does this make it easier can i do it you follow conditional instructions every day you stop at a red light and go on green it feels automatic these conditional stitches will feel automatic within a few row the conditional love scarf layers puffy tubes of colour onto squishy 3 color garter stitch fabric you ll throw this on every day for a joyful pop of color and delightful texture need help choosing 3 colors when i need help i start with one of marianated yarns gradients sets https //marianatedyarns com/collections/jujubee-dk-gradient-set any combination of 3 colours from a set of 6 is guaranteed to look good together if selecting from a monochromatic gradient -- chose non-adjacent colours for better contrast the sample is shown in dk weight yarn you can also knit this in worsted weight or
